intro: Psammogeton stocksii, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial plant with a mat-forming habit, characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its seed capsules are distinctive, often containing numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Psammogeton stocksii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
